apps.app_name_desc: Application Name, as shown on Moonlight
apps.applications_desc: Applications are refreshed only when Client is restarted
apps.auto_detach: Continue streaming if the application exits quickly
apps.auto_detach_desc: This will attempt to automatically detect launcher-type apps that close quickly after launching another program or instance of themselves. When a launcher-type app is detected, it is treated as a detached app.
apps.cmd_desc: The main application to start. If blank, no application will be started.
apps.cmd_note: If the path to the command executable contains spaces, you must enclose it in quotes.
apps.cmd_prep_desc: A list of commands to be run before/after this application. If any of the prep-commands fail, starting the application is aborted.
apps.detached_cmds_desc: A list of commands to be run in the background.
apps.detached_cmds_note: If the path to the command executable contains spaces, you must enclose it in quotes.
apps.env_client_audio_config: The Audio Configuration requested by the client (2.0/5.1/7.1)
apps.env_client_enable_sops: The client has requested the option to optimize the game for optimal streaming (true/false)
apps.env_client_fps: The FPS requested by the client (int)
apps.env_client_gcmap: The requested gamepad mask, in a bitset/bitfield format (int)
apps.env_client_hdr: HDR is enabled by the client (true/false)
apps.env_client_height: The Height requested by the client (int)
apps.env_client_host_audio: The client has requested host audio (true/false)
apps.env_client_width: The Width requested by the client (int)
apps.env_vars_desc: All commands get these environment variables by default:
apps.exit_timeout_desc: Number of seconds to wait for all app processes to gracefully exit when requested to quit. If unset, the default is to wait up to 5 seconds. If set to zero or a negative value, the app will be immediately terminated.
apps.global_prep_desc: Enable/Disable the execution of Global Prep Commands for this application.
apps.image_desc: Application icon/picture/image path that will be sent to client. Image must be a PNG file. If not set, Sunshine will send default box image.
apps.name: Name
apps.output_desc: The file where the output of the command is stored, if it is not specified, the output is ignored
apps.run_as_desc: This can be necessary for some applications that require administrator permissions to run properly.
apps.wait_all: Continue streaming until all app processes exit
apps.wait_all_desc: This will continue streaming until all processes started by the app have terminated. When unchecked, streaming will stop when the initial app process exits, even if other app processes are still running.
apps.working_dir_desc: The working directory that should be passed to the process. For example, some applications use the working directory to search for configuration files. If not set, Sunshine will default to the parent directory of the command

config.adapter_name_desc_linux_1: Manually specify a GPU to use for capture.
config.adapter_name_desc_linux_2: to find all devices capable of VAAPI
config.adapter_name_desc_linux_3: Replace ``renderD129`` with the device from above to lists the name and capabilities of the device. To be supported by Sunshine, it needs to have at the very minimum:
config.adapter_name_desc_win: Manually specify a GPU to use for capture. If unset, the GPU is chosen automatically. We strongly recommend leaving this field blank to use automatic GPU selection! Note: This GPU must have a display connected and powered on. The appropriate values can be found using the following command:
config.address_family_desc: Set the address family used by Sunshine
config.always_send_scancodes_desc: Sending scancodes enhances compatibility with games and apps but may result in incorrect keyboard input from certain clients that aren't using a US English keyboard layout. Enable if keyboard input is not working at all in certain applications. Disable if keys on the client are generating the wrong input on the host.
config.apply_note: Click 'Apply' to restart Sunshine and apply changes. This will terminate any running sessions.
config.audio_sink_desc_linux: The name of the audio sink used for Audio Loopback. If you do not specify this variable, pulseaudio will select the default monitor device. You can find the name of the audio sink using either command:
config.audio_sink_desc_macos: The name of the audio sink used for Audio Loopback. Sunshine can only access microphones on macOS due to system limitations. To stream system audio using Soundflower or BlackHole.
config.audio_sink_desc_win: Manually specify a specific audio device to capture. If unset, the device is chosen automatically. We strongly recommend leaving this field blank to use automatic device selection! If you have multiple audio devices with identical names, you can get the Device ID using the following command:
config.av1_mode_0: Sunshine will advertise support for AV1 based on encoder capabilities (recommended)
config.av1_mode_1: Sunshine will not advertise support for AV1
config.av1_mode_2: Sunshine will advertise support for AV1 Main 8-bit profile
config.av1_mode_3: Sunshine will advertise support for AV1 Main 8-bit and 10-bit (HDR) profiles
config.av1_mode_desc: Allows the client to request AV1 Main 8-bit or 10-bit video streams. AV1 is more CPU-intensive to encode, so enabling this may reduce performance when using software encoding.
config.back_button_timeout_desc: If the Back/Select button is held down for the specified number of milliseconds, a Home/Guide button press is emulated. If set to a value < 0 (default), holding the Back/Select button will not emulate the Home/Guide button.
config.capture_desc: On automatic mode Sunshine will use the first one that works. NvFBC requires patched nvidia drivers.
config.cert_desc: The certificate used for the web UI and Moonlight client pairing. For best compatibility, this should have an RSA-2048 public key.
config.channels_desc_1: Sunshine can allow a single streaming session to be shared with multiple clients simultaneously.
config.channels_desc_2: Some hardware encoders may have limitations that reduce performance with multiple streams.
config.coder_cabac: cabac -- context adaptive binary arithmetic coding - higher quality
config.coder_cavlc: cavlc -- context adaptive variable-length coding - faster decode
config.controller_desc: Allows guests to control the host system with a gamepad / controller
config.credentials_file_desc: Store Username/Password separately from Sunshine's state file.
config.display_device_options_note_desc_win:
Windows saves various display settings for each combination of currently active displays.
Sunshine then applies changes to a display(-s) belonging to such a display combination.
If you disconnect a device which was active when Sunshine applied the settings, the changes can not be
reverted back unless the combination can be activated again by the time Sunshine tries to revert changes!
config.display_device_options_note_win: Note about how settings are applied
config.display_device_prep_ensure_only_display_: Deactivate other displays and activate only the specified display
config.display_device_prep_ensure_primary_win: Activate the display automatically and make it a primary display
config.display_mode_remapping_default_mode_desc:
At least one "received" and one "final" value must be specified.
Empty field in "received" section means "match any". Empty field in "final" section means "keep received value".
You can match specific FPS value to specific resolution if you wish so...

Note: if "Optimize game settings" option is not enabled on the Moonlight client, the rows containing resolution value(-s) are ignored.
config.display_mode_remapping_desc_win:
Specify how a specific resolution and/or refresh rate should be remapped to other values.
You can stream at lower resolution, while rendering at higher resolution on host for a supersampling effect.
Or you can stream at higher FPS while limiting the host to the lower refresh rate.
Matching is performed top to bottom. Once the entry is matched, others are no longer checked, but still validated.
config.display_mode_remapping_resolution_only_m: Note: if "Optimize game settings" option is not enabled on the Moonlight client, the remapping is disabled.
config.ds4_back_as_touchpad_click_desc: When forcing DS4 emulation, map Back/Select to Touchpad Click
config.encoder_desc: Force a specific encoder, otherwise Sunshine will select the best available option. Note: If you specify a hardware encoder on Windows, it must match the GPU where the display is connected.
config.external_ip_desc: If no external IP address is given, Sunshine will automatically detect external IP
config.fec_percentage_desc: Percentage of error correcting packets per data packet in each video frame. Higher values can correct for more network packet loss, but at the cost of increasing bandwidth usage.
config.file_apps_desc: The file where current apps of Sunshine are stored.
config.file_state_desc: The file where current state of Sunshine is stored
config.gamepad_desc: Choose which type of gamepad to emulate on the host
config.global_prep_cmd_desc: Configure a list of commands to be executed before or after running any application. If any of the specified preparation commands fail, the application launch process will be aborted.
config.hdr_prep_automatic_win: Switch on/off the HDR mode as requested by the client
config.hevc_mode_0: Sunshine will advertise support for HEVC based on encoder capabilities (recommended)
config.hevc_mode_1: Sunshine will not advertise support for HEVC
config.hevc_mode_2: Sunshine will advertise support for HEVC Main profile
config.hevc_mode_3: Sunshine will advertise support for HEVC Main and Main10 (HDR) profiles
config.hevc_mode_desc: Allows the client to request HEVC Main or HEVC Main10 video streams. HEVC is more CPU-intensive to encode, so enabling this may reduce performance when using software encoding.
config.high_resolution_scrolling_desc: When enabled, Sunshine will pass through high resolution scroll events from Moonlight clients. This can be useful to disable for older applications that scroll too fast with high resolution scroll events.
config.install_steam_audio_drivers_desc: If Steam is installed, this will automatically install the Steam Streaming Speakers driver to support 5.1/7.1 surround sound and muting host audio.
config.key_repeat_delay_desc: Control how fast keys will repeat themselves. The initial delay in milliseconds before repeating keys.
config.key_repeat_frequency_desc: How often keys repeat every second. This configurable option supports decimals.
config.key_rightalt_to_key_win: Map Right Alt key to Windows key
config.key_rightalt_to_key_win_desc: It may be possible that you cannot send the Windows Key from Moonlight directly. In those cases it may be useful to make Sunshine think the Right Alt key is the Windows key
config.keyboard_desc: Allows guests to control the host system with the keyboard
config.lan_encryption_mode_desc: This determines when encryption will be used when streaming over your local network. Encryption can reduce streaming performance, particularly on less powerful hosts and clients.
config.locale_desc: The locale used for Sunshine's user interface.
config.log_level_desc: The minimum log level printed to standard out
config.log_path_desc: The file where the current logs of Sunshine are stored.
config.min_threads_desc: Increasing the value slightly reduces encoding efficiency, but the tradeoff is usually worth it to gain the use of more CPU cores for encoding. The ideal value is the lowest value that can reliably encode at your desired streaming settings on your hardware.
config.motion_as_ds4: Emulate a DS4 gamepad if the client gamepad reports motion sensors are present
config.motion_as_ds4_desc: If disabled, motion sensors will not be taken into account during gamepad type selection.
config.mouse_desc: Allows guests to control the host system with the mouse
config.native_pen_touch_desc: When enabled, Sunshine will pass through native pen/touch events from Moonlight clients. This can be useful to disable for older applications without native pen/touch support.
config.nvenc_h264_cavlc: Prefer CAVLC over CABAC in H.264
config.nvenc_h264_cavlc_desc: Simpler form of entropy coding. CAVLC needs around 10% more bitrate for same quality. Only relevant for really old decoding devices.
config.nvenc_latency_over_power: Prefer lower encoding latency over power savings
config.nvenc_latency_over_power_desc: Sunshine requests maximum GPU clock speed while streaming to reduce encoding latency. Disabling it is not recommended since this can lead to significantly increased encoding latency.
config.nvenc_opengl_vulkan_on_dxgi: Present OpenGL/Vulkan on top of DXGI
config.nvenc_opengl_vulkan_on_dxgi_desc: Sunshine can't capture fullscreen OpenGL and Vulkan programs at full frame rate unless they present on top of DXGI. This is system-wide setting that is reverted on sunshine program exit.
config.nvenc_preset_desc: Higher numbers improve compression (quality at given bitrate) at the cost of increased encoding latency. Recommended to change only when limited by network or decoder, otherwise similar effect can be accomplished by increasing bitrate.
config.nvenc_realtime_hags: Use realtime priority in hardware accelerated gpu scheduling
config.nvenc_realtime_hags_desc: Currently NVIDIA drivers may freeze in encoder when HAGS is enabled, realtime priority is used and VRAM utilization is close to maximum. Disabling this option lowers the priority to high, sidestepping the freeze at the cost of reduced capture performance when the GPU is heavily loaded.
config.nvenc_spatial_aq_desc: Assign higher QP values to flat regions of the video. Recommended to enable when streaming at lower bitrates.
config.nvenc_twopass_desc: Adds preliminary encoding pass. This allows to detect more motion vectors, better distribute bitrate across the frame and more strictly adhere to bitrate limits. Disabling it is not recommended since this can lead to occasional bitrate overshoot and subsequent packet loss.
config.nvenc_vbv_increase_desc: By default sunshine uses single-frame VBV/HRD, which means any encoded video frame size is not expected to exceed requested bitrate divided by requested frame rate. Relaxing this restriction can be beneficial and act as low-latency variable bitrate, but may also lead to packet loss if the network doesn't have buffer headroom to handle bitrate spikes. Maximum accepted value is 400, which corresponds to 5x increased encoded video frame upper size limit.
config.origin_web_ui_allowed_desc: The origin of the remote endpoint address that is not denied access to Web UI
config.origin_web_ui_allowed_lan: Only those in LAN may access Web UI
config.origin_web_ui_allowed_pc: Only localhost may access Web UI
config.output_name_desc_linux: During Sunshine startup, you should see the list of detected monitors. You need to use the value before the colon in the output. e.g.:
config.output_name_desc_win:
Manually specify a display device id to use for capture. If unset, the primary display is captured.
Note: If you specified a GPU above, this display must be connected to that GPU.

During Sunshine startup, you should see the list of detected display devices and their ids, e.g.:
config.ping_timeout_desc: How long to wait in milliseconds for data from moonlight before shutting down the stream
config.pkey_desc: The private key used for the web UI and Moonlight client pairing. For best compatibility, this should be an RSA-2048 private key.
config.port_desc: Set the family of ports used by Sunshine
config.port_http_port_note: Use this port to connect with Moonlight.
config.port_warning: Exposing the Web UI to the internet is a security risk! Proceed at your own risk!
config.qp_desc: Some devices may not support Constant Bit Rate. For those devices, QP is used instead. Higher value means more compression, but less quality.
config.qsv_slow_hevc_desc: This can enable HEVC encoding on older Intel GPUs, at the cost of higher GPU usage and worse performance.
config.refresh_rate_change_automatic_win: Use FPS value provided by the client
config.refresh_rate_change_manual_desc_win: Enter the refresh rate to be used
config.res_fps_desc: The display modes advertised by Sunshine. Some versions of Moonlight, such as Moonlight-nx (Switch), rely on these lists to ensure that the requested resolutions and fps are supported. This setting does not change how the screen stream is sent to Moonlight.
config.resolution_change_automatic_win: Use resolution provided by the client
config.resolution_change_manual_desc_win: "Optimize game settings" option must be enabled on the Moonlight client for this to work.
config.resolution_change_ogs_desc_win: "Optimize game settings" option must be enabled on the Moonlight client for this to work.
config.restart_note: Sunshine is restarting to apply changes.
config.sunshine_name_desc: The name displayed by Moonlight. If not specified, the PC's hostname is used
config.sw_preset_desc: Optimize the trade-off between encoding speed (encoded frames per second) and compression efficiency (quality per bit in the bitstream). Defaults to superfast.
config.sw_tune_animation: animation -- good for cartoons; uses higher deblocking and more reference frames
config.sw_tune_desc: Tuning options, which are applied after the preset. Defaults to zerolatency.
config.sw_tune_fastdecode: fastdecode -- allows faster decoding by disabling certain filters
config.sw_tune_film: film -- use for high quality movie content; lowers deblocking
config.sw_tune_grain: grain -- preserves the grain structure in old, grainy film material
config.sw_tune_zerolatency: zerolatency -- good for fast encoding and low-latency streaming (default)
config.touchpad_as_ds4: Emulate a DS4 gamepad if the client gamepad reports a touchpad is present
config.touchpad_as_ds4_desc: If disabled, touchpad presence will not be taken into account during gamepad type selection.
config.upnp_desc: Automatically configure port forwarding for streaming over the Internet
config.virtual_sink_desc: Manually specify a virtual audio device to use. If unset, the device is chosen automatically. We strongly recommend leaving this field blank to use automatic device selection!
config.wan_encryption_mode_desc: This determines when encryption will be used when streaming over the Internet. Encryption can reduce streaming performance, particularly on less powerful hosts and clients.

index.description: Sunshine is a self-hosted game stream host for Moonlight.
index.startup_errors: Attention! Sunshine detected these errors during startup. We STRONGLY RECOMMEND fixing them before streaming.
index.version_dirty: Thank you for helping to make Sunshine a better software!
index.version_latest: You are running the latest version of Sunshine

password.new_username_desc: If not specified, the username will not change
password.success_msg: Password has been changed successfully! This page will reload soon, your browser will ask you for the new credentials.

pin.warning_msg: Make sure you have access to the client you are pairing with. This software can give total control to your computer, so be careful!

resource_card.legal_desc: By continuing to use this software you agree to the terms and conditions in the following documents.

troubleshooting.force_close_desc: If Moonlight complains about an app currently running, force closing the app should fix the issue.
troubleshooting.logs_desc: See the logs uploaded by Sunshine
troubleshooting.reset_display_device_desc_win:
If Sunshine is stuck trying to restore the changed display device settings, you can reset the settings and proceed to restore the display state manually.
This could happen for various reasons: device is no longer available, has been plugged to a different port and so on.
troubleshooting.restart_sunshine_desc: If Sunshine isn't working properly, you can try restarting it. This will terminate any running sessions.

welcome.create_creds: Before Getting Started, we need you to make a new username and password for accessing the Web UI.
welcome.create_creds_alert: The credentials below are needed to access Sunshine's Web UI. Keep them safe, since you will never see them again!
welcome.welcome_success: This page will reload soon, your browser will ask you for the new credentials
